Major, Minor, Warning and informational. Advanced management applications can make
use of this information to better evaluate the severity of the situation. This
variable is only intended for use with traps; no meaning should be assumed by a

Major, Minor, Warning and informational. Advanced management applications can make

variable is only intended for use with traps; no meaning should be assumed by a

description: The name of the agent that generated the trap.

description: A short description of the trap.Should be 32 characters or less
variables.name: NAI-MIB::naiTrapShortDescription

description: Additional information delivered with alarm messages and indicated the critical,
Major, Minor, Warning and informational. Advanced management applications can make
use of this information to better evaluate the severity of the situation. This
variable is only intended for use with traps; no meaning should be assumed by a
Manager to the value retrieved through a Get operation on this object.

description: A long description of the event that caused the trap. This
description should be a human readable string that provides
as much information as possible. One way to view this field's
intent is to think of what would be needed in a HelpDesk
ticket's Problem Description field

description: A brief description of the steps necessary to resolve the problem
that is represented by this trap. One way to view this field's
intent is to think of what would be needed in a HelpDesk ticket's
Problem Resolution field.

used to designate the DNS name of the network node which actually
has the problem. If used, the fully qualified DNS name should be
stored here.
